headers.Subject: Reminder: Visit Pacific in August and we’ll waive your application fee!

parts.body:
Personalized tours built for you and your interests

                              New England Campus; California Vibe




Visit Pacific in August and we'll waive your application fee!




                                If you're looking for an ivy-covered collegiate campus with laidback, West Coast energy, check out University of the Pacific, Varadan. We'd love for you to schedule a visit! Our tours are guided by students who can't wait to show you their favorite spots on Pacific's historical campus.                              





                                And as a bonus: If you visit the campus in August, we'll waive the $55 application fee when you apply for admission through the Pacific application within seven days of your visit!                              





Schedule a Tour <https://connect.pacific.edu/portal/undergradvisit?utm_source=Slate&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=APP+FEE+WAIVE&utm_id=visit&utm_content=1>



                                We can't wait to see you on campus.                               





Go Tigers!🐾





Chris Ferguson

Vice President, Enrollment Strategy
                                University of the Pacific





 




Stay Informed About Pacific News & Events
Follow Us on Social Media




 




Have admissions questions?

admission@pacific.edu

                                3601 Pacific Avenue                              

                                Stockton, CA 95211

headers.Subject: Tufts Students Answer "Why Tufts?"

parts.body:
Hi Varadan,

      As you wade into the college search waters, be sure to ask yourself what you want and need in your college experience.

      While you reflect on what you're looking for, current college students may provide some helpful insights. At Tufts, there are many ways to find student voices to learn more about their experiences in the community. Here's where we suggest you start:

	 JUMBO Magazine <https://admissions.tufts.edu/discover-tufts/jumbo-magazine/> -- in each issue, we ask current students our favorite question --  "Why Tufts?" Read the answer from Jed Quiaoit '25 in our latest issue.
	 Jumbo Talk <http://admissions.tufts.edu/blogs/> -- our blogs! We have a dedicated team of bloggers who are eager to share their Tufts experiences with prospective students. 
	 Hear from current students <https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLVUoO64HX951UCTyuxkyGneqdl1VWxaya> -- Tufts is filled with kind students, all of whom are eager to share their journey with academic exploration and finding their fit.

If you have any questions along the way, we're here to help!

    All our best, 
    Tufts Admissions

Tufts is a medium-sized research and liberal arts university of 6,000+ undergraduate students, located in the greater Boston area. We encourage close student-faculty relationships, foster a culture of research and innovation, and celebrate the diverse experiences of our students, who are known for being kind, intellectually playful, down-to-earth, driven, collaborative, and civically-minded. Our students enroll in one of three schools: the School of Arts and Sciences, the School of Engineering, or the School of the Museum of Fine Arts (SMFA). Tufts proudly meets 100% of the demonstrated financial need of all admitted students, regardless of citizenship status.


This email was sent to vk6878@pleasantonusd.net by Tufts Admissions.
Unsubscribe from Tufts University. <https://ugrad.admissions.tufts.edu/go?r=optout&mid=9e54b167-b170-4a5f-8c9c-2a7ca54023c3>

Hi Varadan,

As you wade into the college search waters, be sure to ask yourself what you want and need in your college experience.

While you reflect on what you’re looking for, current college students may provide some helpful insights. At Tufts, there are many ways to find student voices to learn more about their experiences in the community. Here’s where we suggest you start:

  • JUMBO Magazine – in each issue, we ask current students our favorite question –  “Why Tufts?” Read the answer from Jed Quiaoit '25 in our latest issue.
  • Jumbo Talk – our blogs! We have a dedicated team of bloggers who are eager to share their Tufts experiences with prospective students. 
  • Hear from current students – Tufts is filled with kind students, all of whom are eager to share their journey with academic exploration and finding their fit.
If you have any questions along the way, we're here to help!

All our best, 
Tufts Admissions

Tufts is a medium-sized research and liberal arts university of 6,000+ undergraduate students, located in the greater Boston area. We encourage close student-faculty relationships, foster a culture of research and innovation, and celebrate the diverse experiences of our students, who are known for being kind, intellectually playful, down-to-earth, driven, collaborative, and civically-minded. Our students enroll in one of three schools: the School of Arts and Sciences, the School of Engineering, or the School of the Museum of Fine Arts (SMFA). Tufts proudly meets 100% of the demonstrated financial need of all admitted students, regardless of citizenship status.
This email was sent to vk6878@pleasantonusd.net by Tufts Admissions.

parts.body:
Full scholarships to QuestBridge college partners |

 







Dear Varadan,
                                                               

Did you know that top colleges are actively seeking high-achieving students from low-income backgrounds? Through the 2024 National College Match <https://www.questbridge.org/apply-to-college/programs/national-college-match?utm_campaign=CMrecruitment_drip&utm_content=re073&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Slate>, you can apply for free to our college partners and be considered for a full four-year scholarship. Learn more about the program <https://www.questbridge.org/apply-to-college/programs/national-college-match/apply?utm_campaign=CMrecruitment_drip&utm_content=re073&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Slate> and apply by Thursday, September 26, 2024.









Full four-year scholarships to over 50 top colleges


                                QuestBridge's 52 college partners <https://www.questbridge.org/partners/college-partners?utm_campaign=CMrecruitment_drip&utm_content=re073&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Slate> are committed to making college affordable — and even free — for students who excel academically despite financial hardship, and they partner with us to find these students. Some of our college partners include:                              









Apply now <https://apply.questbridge.org/portal/apply?utm_campaign=CMrecruitment_drip&utm_content=re073&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Slate>







                                Over 14,000 students have received full four-year scholarships through the National College Match. These students dared to dream big, and so can you. Start your application today <https://apply.questbridge.org/portal/apply?utm_campaign=CMrecruitment_drip&utm_content=re073&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Slate>.

                                We look forward to reviewing your application!

                                Kind regards,                              









                                Ana Rowena Mallari                              

                                QuestBridge Co-Founder and CEO                              









Learn more about QuestBridge








Watch videos about our college partners → <https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjMa1kvfkoLhM2OhNZBnOJ2vHkeOsDOhx&utm_campaign=CMrecruitment_drip&utm_content=re073&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Slate>






Learn more about who is eligible to apply → <https://www.questbridge.org/apply-to-college/programs/national-college-match/apply?utm_campaign=CMrecruitment_drip&utm_content=re073&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Slate>






Explore materials in our Resource Library → <https://www.questbridge.org/apply-to-college/resources?resourceAudience&utm_campaign=CMrecruitment_drip&utm_content=re073&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Slate[0]=12&resourceTopic[0]=applying>









Have a question? Visit AskQB → <https://questbridge.zendesk.com/hc/en-us?utm_campaign=CMrecruitment_drip&utm_content=re073&utm_medium=email&utm_source=Slate>



QuestBridge | PO Box 51847, Palo Alto, CA 94303

QuestBridge is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.









 


This email was sent to vk6878@pleasantonusd.net by Ana Rowena Mallari.

Full scholarships to QuestBridge college partners |
 

Dear Varadan,
 

Did you know that top colleges are actively seeking high-achieving students from low-income backgrounds? Through the 2024 National College Match, you can apply for free to our college partners and be considered for a full four-year scholarship. Learn more about the program and apply by Thursday, September 26, 2024.

Full four-year scholarships to over 50 top colleges

QuestBridge's 52 college partners are committed to making college affordable — and even free — for students who excel academically despite financial hardship, and they partner with us to find these students. Some of our college partners include:

Apply now

Over 14,000 students have received full four-year scholarships through the National College Match. These students dared to dream big, and so can you. Start your application today.

We look forward to reviewing your application!

Kind regards,

Ana Rowena Mallari

QuestBridge Co-Founder and CEO

Learn more about QuestBridge

Watch videos about our college partners →

Learn more about who is eligible to apply →

Explore materials in our Resource Library →

Have a question? Visit AskQB →

QuestBridge | PO Box 51847, Palo Alto, CA 94303

QuestBridge is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.

headers.Subject: There’s No Better Time to Become a Husker

parts.body:
UNIVERSITY of NEBRASKA-LINCOLN

Varadan,

As you begin your college search process, we want to fill you in on what the University of Nebraska–Lincoln is doing to support you this application season. There is no place like Nebraska, and there is no better time to become a Husker!

Nebraska is test-optional for admission and test-preferred for full scholarship consideration. We encourage students to take the ACT/SAT and submit their test score to maximize scholarship consideration.

Important Dates & Deadlines »

Admission Requirements »

Apply to Nebraska »=> https://admissions.unl.edu/apply/
Visit Campus

The best way to get a preview of all you can accomplish at Nebraska is to experience it for yourself! During your visit, you'll tour campus with a current Nebraska student as your guide and learn more about student involvement opportunities and important admission, scholarship and financial aid information.

Visit Options

Husker Weekdays are available Monday-Friday. This option allows you to tour campus with a current student and meet with a representative from the college of your choice.  

Red Letter Days allow students to tour campus with a current student, eat lunch in a dining center, learn about engagement opportunities and explore resources for success.


	September 13
	October 11
	October 18
	November 1
	November 15


Virtual Visit Week

Attend any of our Virtual Visit Week webinars from September 24–26 to learn about important admissions topics! We'll have sessions for in- and out-of-state scholarships, financial aid and academic sessions with various colleges and the University Honors program. 

Register Now »

The Cornhusker Connection

Join us for The Cornhusker Connection event on Friday, October 4! This half-day visit during Nebraska's homecoming week allows you to visit college open houses, tour the campus, and browse a "Get to Know You" fair featuring various organizations, offices, and college representatives.

Register Now »

Pre-Health at Nebraska

Register for Nebraska's Pre-Health event Monday, October 7! This is a can't-miss opportunity for high school students who are seeking a career in the healthcare field to learn more about what Nebraska has to offer, specific program information and how to prepare for success. 

Register Now »

Plan Your Next Visit »=> https://admissions.unl.edu/visit/
Discover Your Path

Start by making a list of your favorite hobbies and school subjects, then talk to your teachers and counselors about how you can pursue these passions in a career. 

At Nebraska, you'll find the support to create your future as you study what you love.

If you're unsure what to major in, you can apply without choosing. Once you're on campus, the Explore Center will pair you with a professional advisor who will help you identify your interests, skills and values to assist with choosing a major that's right for you.



Explore 100+ Majors »=> https://go.unl.edu/majors
There is no place like Nebraska, and there is no better time for you to be a Husker! If you have any questions, please contact the Office of Admissions at admissions@unl.edu or 402-472-2023.

Clearthur Mangram
Director of Admissions
Office of Admissions
University of Nebraska-Lincoln

UNIVERSITY of NEBRASKA-LINCOLN

Varadan,

As you begin your college search process, we want to fill you in on what the University of Nebraska–Lincoln is doing to support you this application season. There is no place like Nebraska, and there is no better time to become a Husker!

Apply to Become a Husker

The University of Nebraska–Lincoln application for admission is now open! We encourage you to apply for admission by Nov. 1 to be notified of your scholarship awards on Feb. 12.

Nebraska is test-optional for admission and test-preferred for full scholarship consideration. We encourage students to take the ACT/SAT and submit their test score to maximize scholarship consideration.

Important Dates & Deadlines »

Admission Requirements »
Apply to Nebraska »

Visit Campus

The best way to get a preview of all you can accomplish at Nebraska is to experience it for yourself! During your visit, you'll tour campus with a current Nebraska student as your guide and learn more about student involvement opportunities and important admission, scholarship and financial aid information.

Red Letter Days allow students to tour campus with a current student, eat lunch in a dining center, learn about engagement opportunities and explore resources for success.

Attend any of our Virtual Visit Week webinars from September 24–26 to learn about important admissions topics! We'll have sessions for in- and out-of-state scholarships, financial aid and academic sessions with various colleges and the University Honors program.

Register Now »

The Cornhusker Connection

Join us for The Cornhusker Connection event on Friday, October 4! This half-day visit during Nebraska's homecoming week allows you to visit college open houses, tour the campus, and browse a "Get to Know You" fair featuring various organizations, offices, and college representatives.

Register Now »

Pre-Health at Nebraska

Register for Nebraska's Pre-Health event Monday, October 7! This is a can't-miss opportunity for high school students who are seeking a career in the healthcare field to learn more about what Nebraska has to offer, specific program information and how to prepare for success.

Register Now »
Plan Your Next Visit »

Discover Your Path

Start by making a list of your favorite hobbies and school subjects, then talk to your teachers and counselors about how you can pursue these passions in a career.

At Nebraska, you'll find the support to create your future as you study what you love.

If you're unsure what to major in, you can apply without choosing. Once you're on campus, the Explore Center will pair you with a professional advisor who will help you identify your interests, skills and values to assist with choosing a major that's right for you.
Explore 100+ Majors »

There is no place like Nebraska, and there is no better time for you to be a Husker! If you have any questions, please contact the Office of Admissions at admissions@unl.edu or 402-472-2023.

headers.Subject: Your Guide to Brown: Meet Brown University

parts.body:
Distinct for its student-centered learning and deep sense of purpose

Meet Brown University

Brown's innovative Open Curriculum, with no core requirements outside of your concentration, makes you the architect of your own education. This flexible, rigorous approach to the undergraduate experience encourages students to be creative thinkers, intellectual risk-takers and entrepreneurial problem-solvers.

If this purposeful approach to education intrigues you, know that we are here to assist you through your college search process and encourage you to learn more about Brown through our online resources:

	 For more information about the Open Curriculum <https://www.brown.edu/academics/undergraduate/open-curriculum>, applying <http://admission.brown.edu/apply> to Brown, or financial aid <http://admission.brown.edu/tuition-aid>, we invite you to visit the Undergraduate Admission <http://admission.brown.edu/> website.


	 An education at Brown is more affordable than you think. Our Quick College Cost Estimator <http://app.myintuitionapp.org/institution/35aa3353-a90e-4d01-b708-176c38f878f8/costestimator> tool can help you anticipate your college costs and estimate your eligibility for need-based scholarships.


	 Engage with the Brown community online <https://admission.brown.edu/visit>, including a virtual campus tour, or visit us in Providence and take an in-person campus tour <https://admission.brown.edu/visit/campus-tours-0>.


	 Reach out to current Brown students <mailto:askastudent@brown.edu> with any questions.


	 Follow us on Instagram <http://www.instagram.com/brownuadmission/> and Facebook <http://www.facebook.com/brownadmission/>.
 



Learn more <https://www.brown.edu/>   Visit our campus <https://admission.brown.edu/visit>
 

Office of Admission <https://admission.brown.edu/>
401-863-2378 | admission@brown.edu
Take a Virtual Tour of Campus <https://www.brown.edu/admission/undergraduate/#virtualtour>
Questions about life at Brown? | Ask a Brown Student! <mailto:askastudent@brown.edu>

headers.Subject: NSHSS Lifetime of Benefits

parts.body:
A membership that keeps on giving 
National Society of High School Scholars | 
NSHSS | View Online
 
A welcome from an NSHSS Fellows Board Trustee
Kolby Keo, Director of International Affairs at FGS Globaland president emeritus of Young Professionals in Foreign Policy (YPFP), shares his experience as an NSHSS lifetime member.
A Membership That Keeps on Giving
 Today, more than ever, its important to celebrate good news. And thats what this moment isI congratulate you on your invitation to NSHSS! Youve been invited to join a network of accomplished peers who are tomorrows leaders, leading today.When I first got my NSHSS invitation, I wont lie, I was skeptical. What could this group do for me? I took the dive and became a member my junior year in 2008. But even so, I didnt do much with my membership. There was a whole range of programs and benefits I never looked into, and to this day I regret not getting involved earlier. But heres where my NSHSS story gets interesting.It wasnt until seven years later, after graduating high school, attending three different colleges (a story for another time), earning my political science degree at UC Irvine (the first in my family to complete college), and moving across the country to start my first full-time job that I truly realized the lifetime benefits of being an NSHSS member.NSHSS was seeking applicants to join the executive board of theNSHSS Fellows Program. Fellows are NSHSS alumni members who are interested in remaining involved with the organization and working to better themselves and their communities. Three interviews later I was welcomed as board vice president. And after several years with NSHSS Fellows, Ive helped organize dozens of member events, taken the stage in front of thousands, advised NSHSS leaders on the future of the organization, and met and learned from so many brilliant scholars.Ive also sat at the table with corporate CEOs, senior government leaders, and education and nonprofit executivesall thanks to NSHSS. And the great thing is, that as an NSHSS member, you get to meet and engage with these top professionals too.The NSHSS Fellows board members have become my close friends. Though were spread throughout the country, welook out for each other. We lift each other up. And we continually challenge each other to do and be better. With NSHSS, Ive found an invaluable personal and professional community.What these years have proved to me, even after getting involved late in the game, is that NSHSS truly offers a *lifetime* membership. I sincerely hope you decide to be part of our community, and once you join, I emphatically encourage you to take full advantage of your membership. Attend the events, apply for all the scholarships, engage on social media, join a leadership program, find and use your voice, and really take the time to meet and befriend your fellow members.Be safe, be well, and I hope to see you at future NSHSS programs.Cheers,Kolby KeoPacifica High School, Class of 2010University of California, Irvine, Class of 2015Trustee of the NSHSS Fellows Leadership Program
Join NSHSS Today
 

 Stay connected with us on social media for the latest updates and insights!

 Address: 1930 North Druid Hills Road, Atlanta, GA 30319

A membership that keeps on giving
              
National Society of High School Scholars  |   NSHSS  |  View Online
  

A welcome from an NSHSS Fellows Board Trustee

Kolby Keo, Director of International Affairs at FGS Global and president emeritus of Young Professionals in Foreign Policy (YPFP), shares his experience as an NSHSS lifetime member.

A Membership That Keeps on Giving

Today, more than ever, it’s important to celebrate good news. And that’s what this moment is—I congratulate you on your invitation to NSHSS! You’ve been invited to join a network of accomplished peers who are tomorrow’s leaders, leading today.  

When I first got my NSHSS invitation, I won’t lie, I was skeptical. What could this group do for me? I took the dive and became a member my junior year in 2008. But even so, I didn’t do much with my membership. There was a whole range of programs and benefits I never looked into, and to this day I regret not getting involved earlier. But here’s where my NSHSS story gets interesting.

It wasn’t until seven years later, after graduating high school, attending three different colleges (a story for another time), earning my political science degree at UC Irvine (the first in my family to complete college), and moving across the country to start my first full-time job that I truly realized the lifetime benefits of being an NSHSS member.

NSHSS was seeking applicants to join the executive board of the NSHSS Fellows Program. Fellows are NSHSS alumni members who are interested in remaining involved with the organization and working to better themselves and their communities. Three interviews later I was welcomed as board vice president. And after several years with NSHSS Fellows, I’ve helped organize dozens of member events, taken the stage in front of thousands, advised NSHSS leaders on the future of the organization, and met and learned from so many brilliant scholars.  

I’ve also sat at the table with corporate CEOs, senior government leaders, and education and nonprofit executives—all thanks to NSHSS. And the great thing is, that as an NSHSS member, you get to meet and engage with these top professionals too.

The NSHSS Fellows board members have become my close friends. Though we’re spread throughout the country, we look out for each other. We lift each other up. And we continually challenge each other to do and be better. With NSHSS, I’ve found an invaluable personal and professional community.

What these years have proved to me, even after getting involved late in the game, is that NSHSS truly offers a *lifetime* membership. I sincerely hope you decide to be part of our community, and once you join, I emphatically encourage you to take full advantage of your membership. Attend the events, apply for all the scholarships, engage on social media, join a leadership program, find and use your voice, and really take the time to meet and befriend your fellow members.

Be safe, be well, and I hope to see you at future NSHSS programs.

Cheers,
Kolby Keo
Pacifica High School, Class of 2010
University of California, Irvine, Class of 2015
Trustee of the NSHSS Fellows Leadership Program

Stay connected with us on social media for the latest updates and insights!
